alert.note: Alert for Chinle Valley; Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Yavapai County Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 6:41PM MST until February 23 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches within the Colorado River and Chinle Valleys. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 9 inches across the mountains of Yavapai County and in the vicinity of the South Rim of the Grand Canyon. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Areas near Chinle, Dilkon, Eagar-Springerville, Grand Canyon, Holbrook, Kayenta, Kykotsmovi, North Rim, Prescott, Prescott Valley, Saint Johns, Sedona, Seligman, Snowflake- Taylor, Tuba City, Valle and Winslow. * WHEN...Until 6 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will become difficult. Patchy blowing snow will cause areas of significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the Wednesday morning and evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow will impact Coconino and Yavapai counties after 10 PM MST tonight through Wednesday afternoon, and will impact Gila, Navajo, and Apache counties from daybreak Wednesday through the early evening. Additional snow forecast from 6 PM Today to 6 PM Wednesday: Chinle 2 to 4 inches Dilkon 2 to 4 inches Eagar-Sprgrvlle 0 to 1 inches Grand Canyon 3 to 5 inches Holbrook 1 to 2 inches Kayenta 1 to 3 inches Kykotsmovi 2 to 4 inches North Rim 6 to 10 inches Prescott 5 to 9 inches Prescott Valley 4 to 6 inches Saint Johns 0 to 1 inches Sedona 4 to 6 inches Seligman 2 to 4 inches Snowflake-Taylr 2 to 4 inches Tuba City 0 to 1 inches Valle 3 to 5 inches Winslow 1 to 2 inches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
